title: Kershaw to retire after season: 'The right time'
content: Clayton Kershaw, a three-time National League Cy Young Award winner and 11-time All-Star with the Dodgers, will retire after this season. "I'm at peace with it," he said. "I think it's the right time."

title: Witness in 2006 Miami murder case found alive
content: It's unclear how the revelation about witness Paul Conner will affect the murder trial of Rashaun Jones, currently set to start Oct. 6.

title: NFL: Officiate tush push 'tight' after missed call
content: The NFL said the Eagles should have been flagged for at least one false start when they used the tush push against the Chiefs on Sunday and instructed officials this week to call the controversial play "tight."

title: Fever stun Dream, take 1st playoff series since '15
content: The Indiana Fever beat the Atlanta Dream 87-85 to advance to the WNBA semifinals and win their first playoff series since 2015.

title: Sources: ACC closing in on new schedule format
content: ACC athletics directors are scheduled to meet Monday in Charlotte to discuss the details of what will either be a move to a nine-game conference slate with one additional Power 4 game required or an "8+2" model.

title: Source: Packers' Kraft 'all good' after injury scare
content: Green Bay Packers standout tight end Tucker Kraft, who sustained a knee injury during practice Thursday, got "a little scare but all good," a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter after tests Thursday.

title: QB Sellers now probable for S.C. tilt at Mizzou
content: South Carolina quarterback LaNorris Sellers was upgraded to probable on the SEC availability report Thursday, paving the way for him to start in Saturday's game at No. 23 Missouri.

title: Smith Jr. agrees to 1-year deal to return to Mavs
content: Dennis Smith Jr., who was originally drafted by Dallas in the first round of the 2017 NBA draft, has agreed to a one-year deal to return to the Mavericks, agent Daniel Hazan of Hazan Sports Management tells ESPN.

title: üçø Young, Beverley trade words over All-Star effort
content: The exchange between the Atlanta Hawks guard and 12-year NBA pro intensified Wednesday, capped off by a post from the Hawks on Thursday.

title: WWE Wrestlepalooza preview: Cena-Lesnar to kick off ESPN's first Premium Live Event
content: We break down the major Wrestlepalooza storylines, including John Cena vs. Brock Lesnar and the return of AJ Lee.

title: Wetzel: WNBA's gold rush leaves Connecticut fans in the dust
content: The WNBA is repaying Connecticut fans for their loyalty by trying to move the Sun out of state, ESPN's Dan Wetzel writes.

title: How a Dodgers reliever became the unlikely catalyst for baseball's biggest labor battle
content: There are two words MLB and the MLBPA simply cannot agree on. Here's how it got this way and what it means for the next CBA.

title: How do top wrestlers throw down?
content: In professional wrestling, your signature moves create a foundation for success. Learn more how John Cena, Becky Lynch and other stars perform now.

title: Which 0-2 teams still have a shot at the playoffs? Barnwell ranks all 10 by turnaround likelihood
content: Can the Chiefs or Texans turn it around? Do the Bears have a chance in the NFC? Is the season already over for the Giants and Jets?

title: With Haaland and Guardiola, Manchester City can never be counted out in the Champions League
content: Don't tell Pep Guardiola the odds -- as Erling Haaland & Co. showed vs. Napoli, Manchester City are still a threat to win the Champions League.

title: Rashford's brilliant first goals for Barcelona prove Man United exit doesn't define him
content: Marcus Rashford was tasked with proving himself in England. He did that, scoring twice to lift Barcelona over Newcastle.

title: Week 4 kickoff: Arch Manning leads list of QBs falling short, plus breakout players and top quotes
content: Ahead of Week 4, we take a look at big conference matchups, quarterbacks who have room to grow, plus quotes.

content: In the transfer era, playing former teams is commonplace. How each side approaches these games affects game plan and players.

content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Early observations: Is Smith-Njigba a WR1? What to do with Henderson and Loveland?
content: Takeaways on more than a dozen players, including whether you should be patient with a pair of rookies.

title: 'They're done building around him': Inside the tumultuous Kawhi Leonard era in Los Angeles
content: Just weeks after the Clippers shocked the NBA world by signing the 2019 NBA MVP, a feeling percolated across the organization: fear.

content: Bobby Marks and Jeremy Woo break down the top five NBA teams with the most future first-round draft picks, from Oklahoma City to Utah.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team ranks with less than two weeks left
content: Some teams have already clinched postseason berths, while others are making one last push with 11 days to go. Where do they all stand on our second-to-last list?

title: The race for the USMNT's No. 9 shirt is wide open
content: Striker has long been a problem area for the U.S. men's national team. Now, though, the Americans boast four forwards at the top of their game.

title: Will Gladbach's instability prove to be a blessing or a curse for Reyna?
content: Gio Reyna moved to Borussia Monchengladbach to help revive his career. The team already has a new coach.

content: Which shocking early statistical trends have staying power, and which are a product of a small sample size?

content: It's time for new NFL Power Rankings after two weeks! We stacked the best teams and named the biggest QB takeaway for each roster.

title: Can the Giants afford to sit Jaxson Dart for the whole year? Here are the benefits
content: Dart's job is to sit and learn behind Russell Wilson. Can the Giants stay patient and let him develop?

title: What are the odds? Top 25 predicted anytime NFL TD scorers for Week 3
content: Mike Clay's reveals his top 25 predicted touchdown scorers for Week 3, comparing implied odds with ESPN BET's.

title: What happens to a college football roster when a coach is fired in September?
content: UCLA and Virginia Tech fired their coaches Sunday after Week 3 of the college football season. What's next?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Juventus join race for Man City's Bernardo Silva
content: Juventus are looking to sign Manchester City's Bernardo Silva when his contract expires next summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

content: The majors are done for the year -- is it too early to forecast who will reign supreme in 2026? Never.

title: NBA Future Power Rankings: Is your favorite team built to last?
content: Where could the next three seasons take your favorite team? Our NBA insiders are mapping out the futures of all 30.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Buy the dip: Thirteen players primed for bounce-back seasons
content: These fantasy hockey players underwhelmed last season, but could return to better production this year.

title: Was holding a knife? Indian student shot dead by US police in California; how events unfolded
content: Mohammed Nizamuddin, a 32-year-old student from Telangana, was fatally shot by police in Santa Clara, California, after allegedly stabbing his roommate. The incident occurred on September 3rd, but his family was only informed two weeks later. Police responded to a 911 call reporting the stabbing and, upon arrival, encountered Nizamuddin allegedly wielding a knife, leading to the shooting.

title: 'Threats to India, China won't work': Russia slams Trump tariffs
content: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov criticised US tariff threats against India and China, emphasizing their resilience as "ancient civilizations." He noted these nations are seeking new markets and energy sources due to American pressure. Despite tensions and tariff hikes, India and the US are in trade talks, while India and China assert their independence, backed by Moscow.

title: Apple iPhone 17 hits shelves in India; Delhi, Mumbai see massive queues
content: The iPhone 17 launch in India sparked frenzy, with long queues forming at Apple stores in Delhi and Mumbai since dawn. A scuffle erupted outside the Mumbai BKC store, requiring security intervention.

title: ‚ÄòMy restaurant made only Rs 50, understand my pain too‚Äô: MP Kangana to flood-hit Mandi
content: Kangana Ranaut, the Mandi MP, faced protests during her visit to flood-affected Kullu-Manali, with locals displaying black flags and demanding her departure. Ranaut's attempts to explain her personal losses and limited resources sparked further controversy, as she defended her contributions amidst criticism. The region is grappling with the aftermath of devastating floods, causing significant infrastructure damage and loss of life.

title: GitHub rules: CEO Thomas Dohmke to employees; No saying ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt want to use GitHub‚Äô
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke mandates AI tool usage, like GitHub Copilot, for all employees, regardless of their roles. This expectation aligns with Microsoft's approach of incorporating AI usage into employee performance evaluations. Dohmke emphasizes that this isn't about tracking code lines but fostering a culture of continuous learning and adaptation across all departments.

title: 'Sex assault' on employee: Lalit Modi's brother Samir arrested at Delhi airport
content: Samir Modi, brother of Lalit Modi, was arrested at Delhi's IGI airport upon his return to India in connection with a sexual assault case filed by an employee. The FIR alleges repeated instances of rape based on false promises of career advancement.

title: DUSU poll results 2025: Counting of vote begins; ABVP, NSUI locked in close contest
content: Delhi University Student Union elections saw a calmer polling day with a slight increase in voter turnout, reaching 39.4%. While voting was largely peaceful, the NSUI accused ABVP of vote manipulation, alleging marked EVMs. ABVP refuted the claims, citing NSUI's frustration over their growing popularity. First-time voters expressed hopes for improved campus facilities and affordable transport.

title: 48-hour deadline: Elon Musk to xAI staff; ‚ÄòSend me what you did, past four weeks too‚Äô
content: Elon Musk has requested xAI employees to submit detailed one-page summaries of their past accomplishments and future plans, setting a tight deadline amidst company turbulence. This demand follows Musk's pattern of employee performance reviews across his ventures.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for September 19 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a positive outlook for the Indian stock market, highlighting potential gains in Nifty and Bank Nifty. They recommend buying Bharat Electronics, anticipating a rise to Rs 467 within six months, and RBL Bank, projecting a target of Rs 296 in one month, based on technical analysis and market trends.

title: Delhi hit-and-run: Rammed by speeding car, scooter rider falls off flyover, dies
content: Rakesh Kumar Agarwal, a 49-year-old scooter rider, tragically died after being struck by a speeding car on the NH-24 Manglam Cut Flyover in Delhi. The impact caused him to fall off the flyover. The car driver fled the scene, and police are investigating the incident, having identified the car's owner. Agarwal leaves behind his wife and two daughters.

title: Asia Cup Super Four: When is Ind-Pak rematch? Full fixture, format and how to watch
content: The 2025 Asia Cup heats up as India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, and Bangladesh secure Super Four berths in Dubai. Awaiting a final group match, the teams gear up for round-robin clashes, vying for a coveted spot in the grand finale. The highly anticipated India vs Pakistan showdown is slated for September 21st.

title: China‚Äôs AI chip ban: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang; ‚ÄòI‚Äôm disappointed with what I see‚Äô
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expressed disappointment over China's directive to its tech giants, including ByteDance and Alibaba, to halt purchases of Nvidia's AI chips like the RTX Pro 6000D. This decision follows assessments by Chinese regulators indicating that domestic AI processors now rival Nvidia's offerings. Huang acknowledged the volatile nature of Nvidia's China business due to ongoing US-China discussions.

title: Colon cancer breakthrough: Common over-the-counter drug shows big promise
content: A groundbreaking study reveals that a daily low dose of aspirin can significantly reduce the risk of colorectal cancer recurrence by approximately 55% in patients with specific PI3K pathway mutations. The ALASCCA trial demonstrated that aspirin, when taken for three years post-surgery, offers substantial benefits for those with these genetic alterations.

title: Shocking! Bjorn Borg on cocaine addiction & cancer battle: 'So embarrassing'
content: Bjorn Borg's autobiography unveils his past struggles with cocaine addiction, stemming from his early experiences at Studio 54 and escalating during his marriage in Milan. The tennis legend also discloses his prostate cancer diagnosis in September 2023, highlighting the ongoing anxiety and regular check-ups.

title: Asia Cup heartbreak: Wellalage learns of father's death only after Sri Lanka's win
content: Sri Lankan spinner Dunith Wellalage experienced a devastating personal loss after his team's Asia Cup victory over Afghanistan. Unaware of his father's passing in Colombo, the 22-year-old learned the tragic news post-match. Despite a tough bowling performance, his teammates secured the win, but Wellalage immediately left the squad to return home.

title: Did Simone Biles really write a blog mocking Charlie Kirk after his death?
content: A false story spread after Charlie Kirk's death. It claimed Simone Biles wrote a blog about him. The post referenced Kirk's past insults towards Biles. It alleged Biles responded after his death. Fact-checks confirmed the blog was fake. Biles made no statement. Other false posts also circulated after Kirk's death. These posts included fake athlete donations and calls for silence.

title: Destiny blames Musk after getting banned from Twitch ‚Äî 'my income is gone'
content: Political streamer Destiny, Steven Bonnell II, faces a Twitch ban he attributes to a coordinated effort by Elon Musk and conservatives, alleging it's free speech issues following controversial comments on Charlie Kirk. Destiny claims his income is eliminated due to the ban, triggered by 'Hateful Conduct' accusations related to discrimination.

title: Lauren Kyle hosted charity Poker night backing kids for Oilers Youth Foundation
content: Lauren Kyle, Connor McDavid's wife, hosted a charity poker tournament benefiting the Oilers Foundation's 'Every Kid Deserves a Shot' initiative, raising funds and awareness for youth sports in Alberta. While the event highlighted the team's community impact, Connor McDavid's contract situation remains uncertain as he enters the final year of his current deal, focusing on the upcoming season.

title: 'Took my passport, green card and vanished': US cop abandons wife in Hyderabad
content: Hana Ahmed Khan, an Hyderabad woman, faces a nightmare after her US-based police officer husband, Mohammad Zain Uddin, allegedly abandoned her in Hyderabad, taking her passport and green card. She married Zain in 2022 and joined him in the US in 2024, but he left her during a trip to Hyderabad in 2025.

title: 7.8-magnitude earthquake hits Russia's Kamchatka - shocking visuals emerge
content: A powerful 7.8-magnitude earthquake struck Russia's Kamchatka region, triggering a tsunami alert that was later lifted. Visuals showed buildings swaying and objects shaking, but initial reports indicated no significant damage. Located on the Ring of Fire, Kamchatka is prone to seismic activity, having experienced a mega-quake and tsunami just months prior.

title: Spent 9 days under army security: Deposed Nepal PM Oli moves to private house
content: Following widespread unrest in Nepal, former Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli, after nine days under army protection, has moved to a private residence in Bhaktapur. His previous house was burned during Gen Z-led protests. While other political figures sought army shelter, only Sher Bahadur Deuba and his spouse remain under military protection due to injuries sustained during the demonstrations.

title: ‚ÄòLicense should be taken away‚Äô: Trump targets TV networks over negative coverage
content: President Trump suggested potential government action against networks with negative coverage, even hinting at license revocation. This followed ABC's suspension of Jimmy Kimmel after controversial remarks about Charlie Kirk, sparking protests and criticism. The controversy ignited after Kimmel's comments on his show, leading to regulatory scrutiny and accusations of censorship, further intensifying the ongoing feud between Trump and late-night hosts.

title: Chopper scare: Trump‚Äôs helicopter forced to make emergency landing; what White House said
content: US President Donald Trump's helicopter, Marine One, made an unscheduled landing near Luton due to a hydraulic issue during his departure from the UK after a state visit. The incident, described as a ‚Äúminor hydraulic issue,‚Äù prompted the pilots to land as a precaution. Trump and the First Lady safely transferred to a support helicopter.

title: 'What a joke!' BJP rubbishes Rahul's 'vote chori' charge
content: BJP has strongly refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims of vote theft, accusing him of undermining Indian democracy and attempting to create instability akin to Bangladesh and Nepal. Anurag Thakur criticized Gandhi for misleading the public after electoral defeats and questioned the legitimacy of Congress's victory in Karnataka's Aland seat.

title: Handshake row: Mohammad Amir's viral post on Kohli stirs drama before India-Pak rematch
content: The Asia Cup is marred by a handshake controversy following India's victory over Pakistan, escalating with Mohammad Amir's veiled critique of the Indian team via a social media post praising Virat Kohli. This incident led to scheduling disruptions, including a delayed Pakistan-UAE match due to PCB's concerns over the match referee.

title: The silent gallbladder red flag most people mistake for shoulder strain
content: Gallstones, hardened deposits in the gallbladder, can surprisingly cause referred pain in the shoulder due to shared nerve pathways. Inflammation from gallstones irritates the phrenic nerve, leading to shoulder discomfort alongside abdominal pain, nausea, and indigestion. Treatment typically involves surgical removal of the gallbladder, though dietary changes may offer temporary relief.

title: The curious case of Kuldeep Yadav: Alone, yet India‚Äôs trump card
content: Kuldeep Yadav has become the heartbeat of India‚Äôs white-ball success, delivering crucial breakthroughs in the middle overs. From battling injuries, form slumps, and bench time to reinventing his craft post knee surgery, Kuldeep is sharper and more resilient. As India chases more silverware, their wrist-spinner, will remain the ace up the side's sleeve.

title: Who is Annah Gore? Meet Dolphins QB Tua Tagovailoa‚Äôs wife
content: Tua Tagovailoa, the Miami Dolphins' quarterback, balances his high-profile career with a private family life alongside his wife, Annah Gore. Their relationship, which began at the University of Alabama, blossomed into a secret wedding in 2022, later revealed by a media leak. They are now parents to two children, Ace and Maisey, prioritizing family over fame.

title: CBI files chargesheet against Anil Ambani, Rana Kapoor in Rs 2.8k crore corruption case
content: The CBI has filed a chargesheet against Anil Ambani, Rana Kapoor, and Kapoor's family for fraudulent loan transactions causing a Rs 2,797 crore loss to Yes Bank. Kapoor directed Yes Bank to invest in ADA Group companies despite warnings, and funds were allegedly siphoned out.

title: Robo Shankar dies at 46: Tamil actor-comedian‚Äôs sudden demise shocks fans
content: Tamil actor-comedian Robo Shankar, known for his comic timing in films alongside stars like Dhanush and Thalapathy Vijay, has passed away at 46. The actor breathed his last at GEM Hospital in Chennai on Thursday night. As the news broke, tributes poured in from across the film industry including Kamal Haasan, Chief Minister MK Stalin, Varalakshmi Sarathkumar among others.

title: Rs 3,500 crore AP liquor 'scam': 20 places in 4 states, Delhi-NCR searched
content: The Enforcement Directorate conducted searches at 20 locations across multiple states in connection with the Rs 3,500 crore liquor 'scam' in Andhra Pradesh, involving allegations against former CM Jagan Mohan Reddy. The searches targeted companies and individuals suspected of facilitating kickbacks through fraudulent invoices.

title: NBA trade rumors: Lakers eye $60M Knicks star; Luka, LeBron support boost
content: The Los Angeles Lakers are considering acquiring Mitchell Robinson from the New York Knicks to bolster their frontcourt. This move aims to provide Luka Doncic with a reliable lob threat and alleviate defensive pressure on Deandre Ayton. Robinson's expiring contract and defensive prowess make him an attractive target for the Lakers as they build a contender around Doncic.

title: James Cook injury update: Will Bills star play vs. Dolphins? ‚Äî Latest status
content: James Cook is set to play in the Week 3 Thursday Night Football game against the Miami Dolphins, boosting the Buffalo Bills' offense. Cook's presence enhances the Bills' ground attack, complementing Josh Allen's passing game. The Bills, with a 2-0 record, aim to continue their dominance against the winless Dolphins.

title: EC official: Info Rahul seeks shared 2 years ago
content: The Election Commission (EC) refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims regarding voter deletion irregularities in Aland, stating that detailed information was already provided to the Karnataka CID two years prior. The EC clarified that no online voter deletion is possible by the public. In Maharashtra's Rajoura constituency, thousands of invalid voter applications were rejected after scrutiny, prompting a criminal investigation.

title: Why UK Deported Indian National To France Under New Migrant Policy
content: An Indian national became the first person to be deported from the United Kingdom to France under the new returns treaty between the two European neighbours to curb illegal English Channel crossings on small boats.

title: "Manmohan Singh Thanked Me For Meeting Hafiz Saeed": Yasin Malik
content: Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) terrorist Yasin Malik has said that former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh personally thanked and expressed gratitude to him after he met LeT founder Hafiz Saeed in Pakistan in 2006.

title: New York Democratic Politicians Arrested During Protest At Immigration Jail
content: About a dozen New York state and local elected officials were arrested on Thursday during protests at a Manhattan building where US Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents operate holding cells cited by a federal judge for inhumane conditions.

title: Indian Techie Shot By US Police, Family Alleges Racial Harassment
content: A 30-year-old Indian techie was shot by the police in California after he allegedly stabbed his roommate with a knife earlier this month, officials said.

title: "This Is What He Wanted": Charlie Kirk's Wife Named New CEO Of Turning Point USA
content: Two days after Charlie Kirk was shot dead on a university campus, Erika Kirk told supporters: "The movement my husband built will not die."

title: Trump Warns TV Networks Over 'Negative Press' After Jimmy Kimmel Suspension
content: US President Donald Trump has suggested that the government could punish media networks that criticise him.

title: Congress Leader Sparks Row With 'Slap Kangana Ranaut' Remark. She Reacts
content: Former Tamil Nadu Congress chief KS Alagiri has sparked a controversy after he said that actor-politician Kangana Ranaut "should be slapped" if she visits the southern state.

title: Democrats Introduce Free Speech Bill Amid Row Over Jimmy Kimmel Suspension
content: After ABC suspended Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show, congressional Democrats have denounced the Trump administration's threats against political critics and unveiled a bill that would bolster free speech protections against government officials.

title: 3 Sanitation Workers Die Of Suffocation While Cleaning Sewer In Tamil Nadu
content: Three sanitation workers, including one from Rajasthan, died of suspected suffocation while cleaning a ballast tank inside a barge at the Old Port in Thoothukudi district of Tamil Nadu on Wednesday.

title: From Melania's Hat To Epstein's Ghost: Takeaways From Trump's UK Visit
content: Pomp and politics, warm words, tech deals and a sumptuous state banquet. Britain pulled out all the stops to welcome US President Donald Trump.

title: "Will Congress Apologise?" BJP After SEBI's Clean Chit To Adani Group In Hindenburg Case
content: BJP National Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla welcomed the SEBI's clean chit to Adani Group over the Hindenburg report, stating that truth has prevailed and those working against India's economic interests have been dealt a significant blow.

title: UK PM Says Free Speech Must Be Protected, But There Is A Limit
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Thursday that Britain "fiercely" protects free speech, but when it was used to incite real harm to children and vulnerable people there was a limit.

title: US Would Help Secure Peace After Russia's War In Ukraine: Trump
content: The United States would help to secure peace after Russia's war in Ukraine is settled, President Donald Trump said in an interview aired on Fox News on Thursday.

title: Top Putin Aide Dmitry Kozak Resigns As Kremlin Deputy Chief Of Staff
content: The Kremlin said on Thursday that Dmitry Kozak, deputy head of Russia's presidential administration, had resigned, but did not say why or what he would do next.

title: Explainer: ABC's Jimmy Kimmel Suspension And Free Speech Rights
content: Jimmy Kimmel's late-night talk show was suspended indefinitely by TV broadcaster ABC after his comments about the assassination Charlie Kirk prompted criticism from the head of the top U.S. communications regulator against the broadcaster.

title: Trump, Melania Forced To Switch Helicopter While Leaving UK Due To 'Hydraulic Issue'
content: US President Donald Trump concluded his visit to the UK on Thursday. Trump, along with his wife Melania Trump, was forced to switch to a support helicopter while leaving London due to a "minor hydraulic issue," CNN reported, citing White House.

title: 3 Arrested For Defrauding Retired Government Official Of Rs 1.70 Crore In Noida
content: Police in Noida arrested three cyber criminals on Thursday for defrauding a retired official from the Union Ministry of Commerce and Industry of Rs 1.70 crore by digitally arresting him for three days, officials said.

title: Trump Again Takes Credit For India-Pak Ceasefire During UK Visit
content: US President Donald Trump again claimed credit for India-Pakistan cessation of hostilities. However, this time the remark came in the presence of UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

title: 6.1 Magnitude Quake Hits Indonesia's Central Papua
content: A shallow earthquake of magnitude 6.1 struck Indonesia's Central Papua province early Friday, the US Geological Survey (USGS) reported.

title: 7.8 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Russia, Tsunami Warning Issued
content: A 7.8-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Kamchatka in Russia's Far East on Friday, the US Geological Survey (USGS) reported, days after another strong quake in the area.

title: Delhi riots case hearing LIVE: SC to hear bail pleas of Sharjeel Imam, Umar Khalid
content: A Delhi High Court Bench had dismissed the bail pleas of the nine accused, holding that their roles in the conspiracy  appeared ‚Äúprima facie grave‚Äù

title: Telangana man 'shot dead' by cops in U.S., family requests MEA to help in bringing back mortal remains
content: Mohammed Nizamuddin‚Äôs father has requested External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar to help in bringing his son‚Äôs mortal remains back to Mahabubnagar

title: Rains LIVE: 2 killed in Uttarakhand landslides; 606 roads closed in Himachal
content: Since the onset of the monsoon this year, Himachal Pradesh has witnessed 46 cloudbursts, 98 flash floods and 146 major landslides, while 424 people have died

title: Ban on single-use plastic remains a flimsy promise
content: Though Karnataka was the first State in India to pass a law against the use of single-use plastics, it continue to thrive in the face of poor enforcement and civic apathy, finds Chetan B.C.

title: Why Gen Z is taking to the¬†streets | In the U.S., Bangladesh, Sri Lanka and now, Nepal
content: Across the world, young people are protesting ‚Äî against corrupt governments, growing inequality and a lack of opportunities. But can these mass movements,¬†which often begin on social media platforms, bring lasting change?

title: Opposition, ruling parties spar over Rahul's fresh 'vote chori' charges, Congress seeks Fadnavis' resignation
content: ‚ÄúNames often go missing from voter lists, and this had happened when the Congress was in power too. This problem did not arise during the current government,‚Äù Ramdas Athavle said

title: DRI Patna apprehends two suspects involved in wildlife trafficking
content: The criminal syndicates involved in the poaching and illicit trade of leopard skin and ‚ÄúHatha Jodi‚Äù, the reproductive organ of the protected monitor lizard

title: Chaos in Hyderabad markets over rollout of new GST prices
content: With just days to go for the new rates, retailers remain unsure how to bill the old stock even as the GST Department warns strict action for non-compliance from September 22

title: Agenda for sustainable bamboo economy set at Assam conclave
content: The focus is on integrating traditional knowledge with modern technology and leveraging market-driven approaches

title: Supreme Court makes interim bail granted to MLA Jegan Moorthy absolute
content: The case relates to the alleged abduction of a boy, aged over 16, from Kalambakkam near Thiruvalangadu on May 10

title: Sex workers in Kolkata‚Äôs Sonagachi | Only rights can stop the wrongs, says DMSC community
content: Durbar Mahila Samanwaya Committee, a collective of sex workers, turns 30; the community talks about their lives, difficult working conditions, their long-sought demand to be recognised as workers in Kolkata

title: West Bengal CM composes theme song for Durga Puja committee
content: During a meeting at the State Cabinet, the Chief Minister directed Ministers to keep a watch on their constituencies during the Durga Puja festival

title: Indian-origin U.S. woman killed in Punjab at behest of NRI man she planned to marry
content: U.S. citizen of Indian origin murdered in Ludhiana by U.K.-based NRI, Sukhjeet Singh, over marriage refusal, said the police

title: PM Modi to open expanded facilities at Tripura Sundari Temple
content: Tripura Chief Minister Manik Saha inspected arrangements at Udaipur and official said the development project aims to boost religious tourism

title: Lalit Modi‚Äôs brother, held in 2019 rape case; lawyer claims false case to extort money
content: The woman alleged that Samir Modi continuously harassed, assaulted and blackmailed her under false promises of marriage despite knowing he was already married, the police said

title: Supreme Court fines PWD ‚Çπ5 lakh for using workers to clean sewers outside court
content: Amicus curiae, submitted that the incident reflected a blatant disregard of binding directions. He pointed out that video footage showed a minor among those deployed for the hazardous task

content: The CBI had registered two cases in 2022 based on a complaint from Yes Bank‚Äôs chief vigilance officer

content:
Congress and other parties raise concerns over SIR, citing impracticalities;
BJP welcomes the move, accuses Congress of double standards on electoral rolls¬†

title: Modi-Xi meet repaired India-China relations, but its importance should not be overstated: experts
content: The experts were speaking at the launch of the book China: Indian Perspectives on China‚Äôs Politics, Economy, and Foreign Relations, a special publication by The Hindu Group

title: Some districts in north Tamil Nadu to receive heavy rain today
content: With the Southwest monsoon remaining active, rainfall occurred at many places in the State, including Chennai and neighbouring districts. Puducherry and Karaikal also saw widespread rain

title: Passengers escape unhurt after omnibus catches fire on Chennai-Bengaluru Highway in Vellore
content: All the passengers, including 10 women, were rescued. One of them was shifted to the Government Taluk Hospital in Gudiyatham for treatment

title: Protesters rally over alleged introduction of quota for non-SC/ST students in government hostels¬†in U.P.
content: People of General and Other Backward Classes are being allocated seats in these hostels, which is in complete violation of norms, SC students wrote to the U.P. CM

title: West Bengal released 840 prisoners who completed life-term since 2011: Mamata
content: The prisons in West Bengal have been struggling with high occupancy inside correctional homes including the ‚Äòjankhalash‚Äô prisoners (those who remain in prison even after completing their terms)

title: U.S. visas of Indian executives revoked over ‚Äòdrug trafficking‚Äô

title: NCST forms panel to examine extra duties assigned to it 20 years ago

title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi accuses EC of vote chori: Explained

title: Bills prevail in close win against Dolphins
content: new: the win marks the 25th consecutive game for the Bills without losing the turnover battle . the Miami Dolphins beat the Baltimore Ravens 31-21 and improved to 3-0 . a fumble from linebacker Terrel Bernard set up the offense to close out the game .
